intro: Zeyherella longepedicellata, commonly known as the long pedicellate zeyherella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated pedicels and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
